lightArmor.name: Abadarcorp Travel Suit
lightArmor.description: AbadarCorp executives popularized these armored business suits for boardrooms and battle. Contingent force fields and concealed plating protect the wearer in hostile situations.

lightArmor.name: Armored Coat
lightArmor.description: This overcoat is made of real or synthetic leather and reinforced with armored plates. Armored coats are often tailor-made to match the wearer’s personal style.

lightArmor.name: Carbon Skin
lightArmor.description: This form-fitting suit of carbon fiber encases the body. Most are usually dull-gray, functional garments, while pricier, bespoke suits dazzle like diamonds.

lightArmor.name: Estex Suit
lightArmor.description: This bulky flight suit is reinforced with thin polycarbon panels sewn between layers of tactical fabric.

lightArmor.name: Hardlight Series
lightArmor.description: A projector fastened to a belt or lapel encases the wearer’s body in this shimmering hardlight shell. Military-issue hardlight armor follows a predictable standard.

lightArmor.name: Microcord Armor
lightArmor.description: This light armor is woven from ultralight fibers that flex with a wearer’s movements but turn hard as steel on impact.

lightArmor.name: Quilted Armor
lightArmor.description: This armor is made of layered fabrics stitched together and is popular with scavengers.

lightArmor.name: Second Skin
lightArmor.description: Soft but resilient fabric contours perfectly to the wearer’s body, offering basic protection without sacrificing comfort.

lightArmor.name: Tempweave
lightArmor.description: Tempweave suits are reinforced hooded garments woven with thermal fabric and venting wires, popularly worn for trips to humid climates.

mediumArmor.name: Defrex Hide
mediumArmor.description: Made from the hide of a ferocious mammal native to Vesk-2, this medium armor is especially popular among vesk. Tanned slabs are stitched together with metal wires.

mediumArmor.name: Freebooter Armor
mediumArmor.description: Named for the pirates and outlaws who often wear these outfits. Typically consists of a breastplate worn under a jacket or flight suit.

mediumArmor.name: Shotalashu Armor
mediumArmor.description: Flexible but sturdy plates layered together form this traditional armor worn by lashunta cavalry on Castrovel.

mediumArmor.name: Skyfire Armor
mediumArmor.description: These decorative suits feature exaggerated shoulder guards, stylized dragon wings, and draconic emblems. Often plated with gold.

mediumArmor.name: Swarmsuit
mediumArmor.description: Specialized nanites form a mesh suit that shifts to fit wearers with unique or transformable physiologies.

heavyArmor.name: Aegis Series
heavyArmor.description: Starmetal-infused shells that encase the wearer entirely, including an attached visorless helmet. Movement in an aegis suit is clumsy, but powerful.

heavyArmor.name: Defiance Series
heavyArmor.description: This squad armor is a molded shell of reinforced polycarbon with a helmet and retractable visor.

heavyArmor.name: Hidden Soldier Armor
heavyArmor.description: Features a slitted helmet that reveals only the wearer’s eyes. This high-tech ceramic suit consists of breastplate, shoulder guards, bracers, and greaves.

heavyArmor.name: Kyokor Plating
heavyArmor.description: Incorporates a full-coverage polycarbon suit studded with ports and sockets and layered with plates from Daimalko’s infamous colossi.

heavyArmor.name: Thinplate
heavyArmor.description: This sleek but rigid plate armor is often constructed from translucent materials to show off a wearer’s dermal circuitry and worn under baggy clothing.

heavyArmor.name: Veskarium Imperial Plate
heavyArmor.description: Made of interlocking metal plates contoured to the wearer’s body with a scaled pattern. Tailguards and clawed gloves are standard for this armor.

unarmored.name: Flight Suit
unarmored.description: This comfortable coverall is made from lightweight thermal fabric and often adorned with patches displaying personal insignia.
